start.speaker: Pixel
start.text: Level 7 - OBJECTS! The ultimate data organizer! üìö
start.followUp: In TypeScript, we use 'Objects' to store data in key-value pairs. Think of them as labeled treasure chests - every item has a name tag!

options.text: How are they different from arrays?

objVsArray.speaker: Pixel
objVsArray.text: Arrays use numbers (0, 1, 2...), but objects use names (health, mana, strength)!
objVsArray.followUp: Objects make your code readable - no more guessing what index means what!

createObject.speaker: Pixel
createObject.text: Creating objects is easy - use curly braces and key:value pairs!
createObject.followUp: Each key points to a value - like variable names for each piece of data inside the object!

accessObject.speaker: Pixel
accessObject.text: Access values using keys - like looking up stats on a character sheet!
accessObject.followUp: Dot notation is usually easier to read, but bracket notation is great when the key name is in a variable!

options.text: How do I add or change values?

modifyObject.speaker: Pixel
modifyObject.text: Objects can be changed anytime - perfect for tracking changing game states!
modifyObject.followUp: Objects grow with your game - you can add new attributes whenever you need!

removeKeys.speaker: Pixel
removeKeys.text: Remove keys when they're no longer needed - like using up a one-time quest item!
removeKeys.followUp: The 'delete' keyword is how we remove properties from objects in TypeScript!

objectMethods.speaker: Pixel
objectMethods.text: TypeScript has some handy ways to explore your objects!
objectMethods.followUp: These methods help you look inside objects and see what's there!

nestedObjects.speaker: Pixel
nestedObjects.text: Nested objects are perfect for complex game data - like full RPG characters!
nestedObjects.followUp: Nested objects let you organize related data into clear groups!

gameExamples.speaker: Pixel
gameExamples.text: Let's see objects in action for real game systems in Strata!
gameExamples.followUp: Objects are the backbone of data management in most games!

practiceChallenge.speaker: Pixel
practiceChallenge.text: Epic Challenge: Build a complete inventory system using objects!
practiceChallenge.followUp: Track different categories of items and their quantities!

options.text: Objects are perfect for game data!

lessonComplete.speaker: Pixel
lessonComplete.text: üéä LEVEL 7 COMPLETE! You've mastered data organization! üóÇÔ∏è
lessonComplete.followUp: Objects let you build complex game systems - inventories, stats, quests, everything!
